message: I'm new to Dramatica, so bare with me. I've been reading the Theory book (as well as Dramatica for Screenwriters), and I just want to clarify: Will purposes, methodologies, evaluations, and motivations always derive from the Fixed Attitude quad? These are the examples given for archetypal characters, and I'm wondering if this is the quad I should consider while developing more complex characters. Any direction would be greatly appreciated.

The purposes, methodologies, evaluations and motivations of your characters are always derived from the Domain of your Overall Story. If you haven't chosen one, it defaults to the Activity domain (which I think the Archetypal examples come from).
Not dim at all. Everyone eventually asks that question so you're on the right track :)

Ah, thanks. Also, I examined the Table of Story Elements closer, and I realized that the same elements appear in each quad but are arranged differently. That said, my question was pretty dim. Thanks for clarifying all the same. Much appreciated.
I was going to say I've had this exact conversation with Jim myself. I think it's a milestone.
I am yet to get to this question...damn still a long way to go.
